cellularAutomata.artificialLife.geneticOperator
Class Crossover

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.artificialLife.geneticOperator.Crossover
All Implemented Interfaces:
GeneticOperator
public class Crossover
extends java.lang.Object
implements GeneticOperator

A standard crossover operation. Two parents produce a single child that is constructed from parts of each parent. The crossover operation occurs only at one point.

Crossover only occurs with a probability set by "crossoverProbability". If no crossover occurs, then one of the parents is returned unaltered.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

Crossover

public Crossover(double crossoverProbability)
Creates a standard crossover operator.

Parameters:
crossoverProbability - Crossover only occurs this percentage of the time (otherwise no crossover occurs). Must be between 0.0 and 1.0. If less than 0.0 or greater than 1.0, defaults to 1.0.
Method Detail

performOperation

public Chromosome[] performOperation(Chromosome[] chromosomes)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The standard single-point crossover operation for BitChromosomes. This randomly chooses a crossover location on the two parent chromosomes. Then constructs the child chromosome from the left side of parent1 and the right side of the parent2. Parent1 and parent2 are chosen randomly.

Specified by:
performOperation in interface GeneticOperator
Parameters:
chromosomes - The chromosomes on which crossover takes place. Requires two chromosomes. More or less will throw an exception. Both chromosomes must be of type BitChromosome.
Returns:
The result of the crossover, a single BitChromosome.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there are more or less than two chromosomes in the parameter array.
